title: 114_s3173
content: The "EHR Regulatory Relief Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a 90-day EHR reporting period for determining if an eligible professional or hospital is a meaningful EHR user. The "EHR Regulatory Relief Act" introduces a 90-day EHR reporting period for eligible professionals in 2018 and subsequent years. This period is also applicable under MIPS for performance evaluation as determined by the Secretary. The EHR Regulatory Relief Act introduces a 90-day EHR reporting period for eligible hospitals starting in 2018 and subsequent years, as determined by the Secretary. SEC. 3. REMOVING THE ALL-OR-NOTHING APPROACH TO MEANINGFUL USE. The text chunk discusses the flexibility for determining meaningful use for eligible professionals and hospitals under the Social Security Act. Eligible professionals may be considered meaningful EHR users if they meet at least 70 percent of the measures established by the Secretary for the EHR reporting period. Eligible hospitals also have similar flexibility in meeting meaningful use requirements. The Security Act is amended to provide flexibility for determining meaningful use for eligible hospitals based on performance with specified objectives and measures established by the Secretary. The Security Act is amended to allow eligible hospitals to qualify as meaningful EHR users by achieving 70 percent of specified measures or a composite score determined by the Secretary. Conforming amendments are made to sections 1848(o)(2)(A) and 1886(n)(3)(A) of the Social Security Act. SEC. 4. EXTENDING FLEXIBILITY IN APPLYING HARDSHIP EXCEPTION FOR MEANINGFUL USE. This section extends flexibility for eligible hospitals to qualify as meaningful EHR users by achieving specified measures or a composite score determined by the Secretary. For the 2016 EHR Reporting Period, an amendment is made to the Social Security Act regarding the 2018 Payment Adjustment for Eligible Professionals. The amendment includes changes to deadlines and definitions related to the program. The term 'applicable date' is defined for payment adjustments in 2017 and 2018. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act for Eligible Hospitals for EHR Reporting Periods and Payment Adjustments for Fiscal Years 2018 and 2019. Amendments to the Social Security Act define the 'applicable date' for payment adjustments in 2017, 2018, and 2019.
